PEN.name: A pen
PEN.description: Ink flows freely... into your shirt pocket.

INCRIMINATINGEVIDENCE.name: Incriminating Evidence
INCRIMINATINGEVIDENCE.description: Very incriminating proof that something troubling is going on in the White House.

TEACHERROOMKEY.name: Key to the West Room
TEACHERROOMKEY.description: The key is imprinted with the seal of the President.

WARVETROOMKEY.name: Key to the East Room
WARVETROOMKEY.description: The key is imprinted with the seal of the President.

CABINETROOMKEY.name: Key to the Cabinet Room
CABINETROOMKEY.description: The key is imprinted with the seal of the President.

NOTBADKEY.name: Key to the Situation Room
NOTBADKEY.description: The key is imprinted with the seal of the President.

BRIBE.name: Bribe
BRIBE.description: Is there anything more convincing than money? Buying loyalty gets expensive so be careful.

CALLVATICAN.name: Call Battycan
CALLVATICAN.description: Brings in 2 additional ReligousNuts at 2 levels lower than this one

DAZZLE.name: Dazzle
DAZZLE.description: Being dazzling and admirable is a great way to take heat off politics

DEFENSE.name: Defense
DEFENSE.description: Gather strenth; -50% to all incoming attacks

FILIBUSTER.name: Filibuster
FILIBUSTER.description: You're not moving until they give in. Cause opposition to miss their turn

GREATSUIT.name: Look Great In Suit
GREATSUIT.description: Well, we could argue, but have you noticed how fabulous this suit is? Medium attack with high chance of critical.

HUMANSHIELD.name: Human Shield
HUMANSHIELD.description: No further questions. Step back, please. Causes all targets to miss their next turn.

INSPSPEECH.name: Inspirational Speech
INSPSPEECH.description: Restore a small amount of votes to all party members

JOKE.name: Joke
JOKE.description: Ha, ha, ha...what were we talking about? Diffuse the situation with some humour. High chance of critical hit. Knock 'em dead!

LIE.name: Lie
LIE.description: It's only lying if they catch you. A strong attack with a danger of critically failing

LOSELOSE.name: Lose/lose issue
LOSELOSE.description: Causes all politicians in the target radius to lose votes

MESSAGE.name: Stay On Message
MESSAGE.description: You can certainly wear them down by repeating your party line over and over and over...if you want

NATIONALSECURITY.name: National Security
NATIONALSECURITY.description: This is a matter of national security and they don't have codeword clearance Solid basic attack.

NEGATTACKAD.name: Negative Attack Ad
NEGATTACKAD.description: Take them all down. They're definitely all bad people. Not like you.

PAYOFF.name: Pay Off
PAYOFF.description: Causes them to miss a number of turns

PORKBARREL.name: Pork Barrel
PORKBARREL.description: Do something that benefits them specifically. Not advised against politicians.

PRPREP.name: PR Prep
PRPREP.description: If you're going to need some spin, best see a spin doctor! Adds spin points.

RALLY.name: Rally Constituents
RALLY.description: Get back some votes by rallying supporters

RALLYENEMY.name: Rally Constituents
RALLYENEMY.description: Get back some votes by rallying supporters

REVIVE.name: Revive
REVIVE.description: Revive a defeated comrade to half votes

RUNAD.name: Run Advertisement
RUNAD.description: Gets back up to 15 votes by running an ad

SCARE.name: Scare Campaign
SCARE.description: Nothing rattles the brains like fear.

SING.name: Rousing Song
SING.description: Why bandy words with politicians when you can sing a catchy tune! Restores votes.

SLANDER.name: Slander Opposition
SLANDER.description: Strong against polititians...careful with those voters, though!

BILLBOARD.name: Billboard Ad
BILLBOARD.description: Run a billboard ad to restore up to 30 votes

REVIVEITEM.name: Revive
REVIVEITEM.description: Revive a defeated comrade to half votes

LEGSPEECH.name: Legendary Speech
LEGSPEECH.description: Remembered throughout the ages. Restores a lot of votes for all party members

TVAD.name: Run TV Advertisement
TVAD.description: Prime time TV gets the most votes. Restore up to 40 votes.

undefined.dialog: Before we pit you against the great political minds of our age, it might be a good idea to train you against...easier prey.

Receptionist.dialog: You must be Mayor Goodman's new assistant. He's in his office.
The Mayor is looking for his pen. He seemed to think you'd know where it was.
Did that buffoon accuse me of stealing again? This is MY pen and he isn't having it.
Receptionist sighs and hands over the pen.
If you're ever getting low on votes, come talk to me and I'll run an ad campaign to restore them.
You've taken a beating, let me fix you up.

Mayor.dialog: Hello, I'm the Mayor!
Hello, Mayor Goodman, I'm Philip Mossman.
Ah yes, you're my new assistant. You'll want to learn a thing or two about politics before we get started.
Becoming a great politician boils down to one thing; your ability to win arguments.
Whether it be national debates or swaying constituents and lobbyists to support you, it all comes down to your ability to out-think your opponent.
You see, I've been searching for minutes and haven't been able to find my pen! I bet my receptionist stole it. She has sticky fingers.
Well, don't just stand there, go and get it from her! You'll need to use all of your political skills to wrestle it back. She's like a bulldog when she gets ahold of something.
Are you simple? Go and get my pen from that thieving receptionist.
Great! I know she can give you a bit of a tongue-lashing, but she's a fantastic receptionist.
I'm sure you want to learn a thing or two about politics - who doesn't? - so lets get started
Run outside and tell those protesters to scram, will you?
Hope they didn't give you too much trouble!
Now that's sorted, there's a journalist from the local newspaper coming for an interview.
I certainly don't have time for it, so you can do the interview.
Be careful not to give too much away and if you could throw a few punches at the opposition that'd help.
You want me to...throw a punch?
You're in politics and don't know how to fight dirty? Sheesh! Here, let me show you.
Mayor teaches Phillip to Slander Opposition
It's a pretty great tactic because it keeps eating away at them long after you've done it.
Go handle that interview and remember to slander the opposition.
OK, fine, now could you buzz off for a while? I need to get some work done.
Go home to your family. I have things to do that don't involve you.
What's this I hear about you campaigning for Mayor? After everything I've taught you!
I'm sorry Mayor Goodman, but it's time for someone who's ready to make a difference for our town.
You really are a fool. Do you think He's going to allow that?
Well, you've beaten me but you don't have a clue what you're in for. I hope you're up to this kid!

Head Protester.dialog: I am the head protester. You'll never convince us to back down!
See? What a fascist, ALL people you slimey politician scum!
Alright, fine! We'll stop protesting...whatever we were protesting.

Protester1.dialog: Fee Fi Fo Fum, we think Mayor Goodman's Dumb!

Protester2.dialog: Bees buzz, Mayors lie, who's this Phillip Mossman guy?

Journalist.dialog: Leave me alone, kid I need to get this done before my deadline!
He couldn't make it. I'll be taking the interview.
SNORE! Fine, if I can't get anything juicy here I'll do another puff piece on my poodle Frank.

Wife.dialog: What are you doing here, Phillip? You should be at work!
Welcome home, Phillip! How was your workday?
That good, huh? You know this isn't what you want. Why don't you strike out on your own?
I didn't think I knew where to start to be a Mayor, but Mayor Goodman makes it look easy.
That's the spirit! You can do it! All you need is some money and support.
Well...OK! Lets start with money. We need a sponsor.
Sarah Mossman Joins Your Political Party!

Sponsor.dialog: Hmmm...Money, money, money. Sorry, what? I wasn't talking to you.
Hello, I'm investigating new investments today. How can I help you?
Well, I've decided to run for Mayor! I could really use an investor.
I don't know. You seem a little young. I don't think I'm convinced.
Wow! You sure have what it takes! Alright, here's a pile of cash!
Also, now that you have some funds, you might find it useful to...grease the wheels in some difficult situations.
Phillip and Sarah learn to Bribe
Er, thanks! I suppose we should go gather some support from our constituents now.
Makes sense to me! I'm off, too. Money, money, money.

Constituent1.dialog: Why? How will you help local business?

Constituent2.dialog: But Mayor Goodman has always taken care of me.
I think it's time for a change!

Constituent3.dialog: But Mayor Goodman has always taken care of me.
I think it's time for a change!
I think I'm ready to take on Mayor Goodman now!

Marketing1.dialog: I'm sorry, my time is precious. Come back if you're ever running for office.
Hi there! Are you interested in any of my ad campaigns or programs?

Marketing2.dialog: Hi Phil! Would you like to run an ad?

SouthWingDoor.dialog: The door appears to be locked
The door unlocks with a satisfying 'click'

Politician1.dialog: I'm sorry Mayor Mossman, the Governor cannot see you now. He's very busy
It's very important. I need to understand what Mayor Goodman was talking about. It was clear there were other powers at play.
Yes well, I fail to see how your county spat has anything to do with Governer Badden.
Fair point. The governor will see you now.

Politician2.dialog: What are you doing in here? Who are you? Some Mayor?
I am Mayor Phillip Mossman. I'm here to speak to the Governor.
I'm afraid the Governor's schedule is very tight. Come back next month.
I see. Well, maybe we can squeeze you in.

Governor.dialog: I'm very busy. Please speak to the others.
You have quite a way with words, Mayor Mossman. Why are you here?
Mayor Goodman said some troubling things, Governor Badden. I'm here to get to the bottom of it.
If I knew anything about what you're talking about, I wouldn't tell you. I don't trust you at all.
What can I do to convince you?
Well...there's some hicks in the south wing that I've been dodging. They want to know about the recent funding cuts. Get rid of them.
The Governor gives you a key.
I'm not saying another word until you get rid of the hicks in the south wing.
OK, I've taken care of your problem, now I want my answers.
No, word has come down from the top that due to the last Mayor's idiocy we're tightening the inner circle to Governors and above.
From the top...so you're saying the only way I'll find out what's going on is to be a governor myself?
Wait...no...I said I wasn't going to tell you, I...
This is it, governor. Prepare to fight for your office!
Nooo! President Allen doesn't deal well with defeat. What will happen to me?
The President? What does he have to do with this?
You really have no idea what you've gotten into, do you? Well, you've gotten all you're getting out of me. I'm getting out of here!

Theo.dialog: The Governor is in the north wing.
You must be Governor Mossman. I am Theo. I've been looking for you, but I wanted to see how you handled Governor Badden
Hi Theo. Why have you been looking for me?
There's a lot going on in Ignited States politics and none of it is good. Somebody needs to get up there and find out what's going on.
I couldn't be sure which side you were on, but your dealings with the Governor prove that you're not with them.
It sounds like it goes all the way to the President of the Ignited States.
It does. That's why I've been looking for you. The only way to find out is to flush them out. There's only one way to flush out President Allen.
...I've been a campaign manager for 20 years and I've never seen a candidate as strong as you. I think you have what it takes to run for the presidency.
That's why I was looking for you. I need somebody who has a shot at winning in order to get to President Allen. You have that shot.
You really think I can win? Well...I want to follow this through to the end, so I'm in!
Great! There's a lot to get organised! We need to plan our election campaign!
First things first. I can teach you how to filibuster. It helps to get your opposition to stay put while the rest of your party moves in to attack.

Hick1.dialog: Look at this guy's fancy tie!
What brings you to the office of the governor?
Yes, to steal our jobs and our wives!
I don't think the immigrants are coming to steal your wives...
Mayor Mossman sides with the immigrants! I need to get this to print!
Wait a second, let me explain.
You're a smart guy. I think I can trust you.

Hick2.dialog: Wowee. We've been waiting for days and the governor has ignored us. If you ever run for governor, you'll have my vote!

Journalist2.dialog: Governor Badden sends his Mayor lacky to do his dirty work  what a scoop!
I'm going back to write a comparison piece on you and Governor Badden. You should consider running for Governor.

Marketing3.dialog: Hi Phil! Would you like to run an ad?

StairsToBasement.dialog: Smells like a basement. I have no business going down there.

StairsToGround.dialog: I don't feel like going downstairs yet.

StairsToL3.dialog: I don't need to go up these stairs.

PA.dialog: Good morning, Governor Mossman. I am your personal assistant, Sampson

You've a busy schedule, so let's get going! We've called together our entire political party in order for you to get them all to agree on a platform. We had to keep them separated, so they're in the adjoining rooms.
Please try to stay on schedule. The politicians are in the adjoining rooms.
Hmmm, falling behind already, Better get a move on!
This might come in handy for your next meeting.
We need some funds for our war chest! Head upstairs and meet with the lobbyists.
Go get those funds! The lobbyists are upstairs.
No time for lunch! A flock of religious nuts has taken up residence in the lobby downstairs.
You'll need to go in and try to ... reason  with them.
I need you to go downstairs and handle the religious nuts.
Wow, you got those crazies to back us?
And a lifetime supply of French Roast!
Right  well, moving on
You have an appointment with a shady looking man who absolutely insisted on speaking to you.
I left him in the basement where he felt most comfortable.
Deal with him quickly, would you?
Head down to the basement and talk to the shady looking man.
OH MY GOD where have you been?
We will NEVER get the schedule back on track now. Hurry, you're due to appear on the Hercules O'Grady show!
Look your best, get ready and don't say anything stupid! They're filming live in the lobby. Get down there, quick!
This close to Super Tuesday, it's back-to-back TV appearances. It's time for your big debate with President Allen!
The TV representative is waiting outside to take you to the studio.
Listen, the shady-looking man in the basement called again.
He insisted that you go and see him again before you do anything else.
You'd best hurry! It's nearly time for the final debate. Go see the shady-looking man in the basement again.
It's time for the final debate! There's nothing left to say except good luck, Governor Mossman!

Politician3.dialog: Good morning, Governor Mossman. Your PA will know your schedule. He is waiting beside the stairs
We must all agree that the most important thing is science! If we're not for science, what's the point.
There's a lot of great things we can do for science but the funding will need to be shared with health and education and...
Alright, fine! A balanced platform (but mostly science).

Politician4.dialog: Good morning, Governor Mossman. Your PA will know your schedule. He is waiting beside the stairs
I'm for culture! It's a glorious age we live in, we should further this great country's culture.
That sounds fair, but what kind of culture would you like to focus on.
Oh...I don't know, I'm not really into art, can't really handle music. I'd rather not go to the theatre if I can get out of it. Don't really see the point of sport...hmmm. New culture?
You don't seem very in to improving culture really.
Yeh, well...my wife said it would make me sound smart. I think sounding smart is important. Lets be for that!
Gee, you're a pretty smart guy. I think you've got this covered.

Politician5.dialog: Good morning, Governor Mossman. Your PA will know your schedule. He is waiting beside the stairs
You want to grow our business sector? Provide more jobs?
No! We need to make it BIGGER!
OK, I see what you're getting at. Lets help small business to grow. Also, this might help even the odds in the future.
The results can be a bit unpredictable, so only use it in drastic situations.

Politician6.dialog: Good morning, Governor Mossman. Your PA will know your schedule. He is waiting beside the stairs
We should be all about not wasting money
Sounds fair. Wasting money on what?
You know, stuff that doesn't really help like artsy stuff.
You don't think we should invest in our culture?
We have more important things to spend our money on. Like military.
What if people want to paint pictures about our military. Or write patriotic songs?
So, militaristic march songs and battle scenes aren't the only sort of art? Wow.

Politician7.dialog: Good morning, Governor Mossman. Your PA will know your schedule. He is waiting beside the stairs
I believe in captialism. Let business sort itself out. They shouldn't need to rely on government handouts.
Also, I think politicians need a raise. Some more than others...oh and life-long retainers.
So, no more hand-outs for business but more handouts for politicians?
Right, I guess we need to handle the needs of our constituents, too.

Lobbyist2.dialog: I represent the Python Software Foundation. What will you do to promote, protect and advance the Python programming language?
Ah yes, the Python cause! I'm a big advocate of Python.
I think we can help each other out.

Lobbyist3.dialog: To get the support of my organisation, you'll need to tell me what you can do for the conservation of internet memes.
Yes, these are serious times. Who remembers hitting the giant crab for massive damage.There's another console release. I bet you can't even remember what you had to do to get massive damage.
You have to flip him over, that's what! We have to act quickly to save the internet memes. Even as I speak, fewer and fewer Gangnum style videos are made. It's a crime!
We need to build safehouses for all of the lolcats, provide IT helpdesk support for rickrole education and somebody needs to save the Sharknado from extinction!

Lobbyist4.dialog: Please tend to your other meetings so that we can see you.
If you are elected, I would like to know what you would plan to support the Storyteller's Guild and their efforts to revive a lost art.
I'm all for protecting the arts. How can I help?
Storytelling is being butchered and almost completely ignored. I could list movies and television, but the real culprit is video games.
Many video game plots are derivative and archaic. Why, if this were a video game, it would have almost no substance at all and simply be a flimsy curtain for one of their "fetch quests".
It is a most serious problem and we wouldn't be able to lend you our support without assurances on this matter.
While I feel that your argument lacks substance and detail, I will nevertheless concede.

Religious4.dialog: Welcome, my child. We have travelled here from Battycan City to be assured you are a man of faith before we endorse you.
Why, the one true god: Coffee.
Yes of course. He who lifts you up when you're feeling low, who is your inspiration in the dark and who can achieve miraculous feats of effort with dedicated prayer.
This may be a religion I can get behind.
Wonderful, the Battycan will be most pleased.

Religious1.dialog: Have you had your morning prayer?
Some people pray upwards of 5 times a day, but this can cause hallucinations.

Religious3.dialog: I must return to my meditation.

Religious2.dialog: Do not be swayed by the seductive powers of tea!
The Battycan will be satisfied with this news.

DeepThroat.dialog: Finally, I thought you were going to be too late.
What can I do for you Mr er...?
No names! I have something I think you'll be interested in, but I'm not sure you can be trusted.
Look, Mr Er...I'm very busy, what is this about?
It's about the President, it's about national security, but I've got a bad feeling and I'm getting out of here.
You're right, I have every reason to trust you. I've found this Incriminating Evidence.
Yes, but not by me. I've given you all I've got, now get out.
It's a lot worse than I thought. I have more to tell you, but I don't think I should trust you. I think there's a leak in your operation somewhere.
There was a lot of heat on me after we last spoke.
It's getting close to the final election. It could just be that they're getting skittish.
You're right, I'm just edgy. Look, I think you should be careful. I think the President is planning to KILL you in the final debate... politically.
You think he wants to silence me forever. On the political stage?
Yes I do. This could get really messy... politically speaking. So be careful!

TVPersonality.dialog: Ooooh, sorry Mossman, baby! We're not ready for you yet.
There's the man! Are you ready to cross wits with The Mighty Hercules!
Really...? You don't want to...see your make-up artist?
... from the looks of it, suiting yourself is exactly what you did.
Good show, you sure gave me a run for my money.
Now beat it, you're making me look bad!

TVDebate.dialog: Hmmm? Oh, sorry, I'm on the phone to the studio.
Good evening, Governor Mossman. If you'll follow me, I'll take you to the studio.
Great work tonight, Governor Mossman and congratulations on the win!

P-med-23.dialog: You think you can take me?
I have to know what you're up to!

P-med-24.dialog: You think you've beaten me, but now you're going to fight the real me!
I knew something was wrong, but this...?
All you've done is caused me to expedite my plans to enslave the human race!

StairsToWhiteHouse.dialog: I can't go upstairs now, I have a job to do!

DoorToWhiteHouseBasement.dialog: What a strange looking door. It doesn't even have a keyhole, but it doesn't open when I push it.
The door opens with a satisfying *beep*.

DoorToCabinetRoom.dialog: The door appears to be locked, and no amount of gesticulating can attract the attention of the inhabitants of this room.
The door opens with a squeak.

DoorToWarVetRoom.dialog: What does a president have to do to get a door opened around here?
The door opens with nary a sound.

DoorToTeacherRoom.dialog: The teachers look up as you enter the room.

PA2.dialog: Welcome to the White House, President Mossman. It was a long campaign trail with a very strange final debate, but we won and we're here.
Now is the real test where we see how well we can run a country.
The first step is to give your first press conference as President to explain the...situation...with President Alien *cough* I mean Allen.
They're waiting for you in the rose garden, Mr President.
I think that went as well as could be expected.
Your secret service detail is waiting inside to have a word with you about security protocol.
You'd better speak to the secret service agent. Your security is paramount.
Some war veterans would like to speak to you about some recent decisions you've made. I don't dare turn them away. You'd better speak to them.
Of course.
Received key to the West Room.
The war vets are waiting for you in the West Room.
What was that about?
I'd like to know as well. Find me the documents that approved troop movement today and get me a meeting with the Joint Chiefs.
Yessir.
Your next meeting is with the teachers in the corridor. They didn't give me the details, but it seems they're quite upset.
Received key to the East Room.
You'll need to speak to the teachers in the East Room, Mr President.
You seem to have sorted the teachers out.
I've mollified them for now, but I want to get to the bottom of this - NOW!
Of course, Mr President. I do have those papers you asked for that approved the mobilisation of troops
Let me see those...this is my signature! But I didn't sign this!
This is very serious! What should we do, sir?
Call a cabinet meeting. Immediately.
Understood. They'll be there when you get there.
Received key to the Cabinet Room.
The cabinet is waiting for you in the Cabinet Room.
The Joint Chiefs are assembled in the Situation Room downstairs.
Your palm print has been coded for maximum clearance now; you should have access to the basement.
Get to the basement, the Joint Chiefs are waiting.

Journalist3.dialog: Mr President, Cal from Daily LOL magazine. Can you explain the transformation that occurred during the presidential debate.
Certainly, Cal. The President of the Ignited States turned into an alien.
Ah, you mean to say he's out-of-touch with his people?

Journalist4.dialog: President Mossman, a moment of your time?
President Mossman, what do you believe was President Allen's failing strategy on the campaign trail? He presented some strong arguments.
Well, I'd say he went wrong when he decided to try to enslave the human race to mine the Earth's natural resources and ship them back to his home planet.
And how does that differ from your own strategy?
I would say I disagree with the former President on all of those issues.

Journalist5.dialog: Do you feel that a bi-partisan relationship will be possible between your party and the opposition?
I suppose once we find and remove all of the aliens and reverse the alien brainwashing, bi-partisanship will resume.

Kawalski.dialog: I'm not allowed to speak to you, sir.
A pleasure to meet you, President Mossman. I am Agent Kawalski, your security detail.
Great to meet you, Agent Kawalski. What do I need to know?
Well actually, it does have to do with your security. Something terrible is happening at the White House.
If you're trying to warn me about the aliens, it's under control.
No, no, this is different. I think somebody is trying to take over the White House.
It's too early for those kind of details. I just want you to keep your eyes open, Mr President.

WarVet1.dialog: You think you can fool me? I wasn't born yesterday, you know.
I'm sorry, sir, but what seems to be the problem.
You think I don't know a mobilising army when I see one? You're clearly readying for war and you think you don't even need to mention it to the people.
And don't forget that he's barely a cadet, Wilfred.
Right you are, Arnold, You've barely set foot in this building and you're already leading us to war. Who do you think you're dealing with? We won't stand.
Seems like a flimsy excuse, you didn't know. Better get your troops in line if you want 'em to march, boy.

WarVet2.dialog: We'll head home, but you can expect us back if we see anything else suspicious .

Teacher1.dialog: Good day, Mr President. I have to say I'm most displeased with the current state of affairs around the education budget.
Agreed. This is simply unacceptable. We will need to close down schools!
I'm sorry, I don't understand your concern. My education plan was one of the linchpins of my election campaign.
And precisely one of the reasons I voted for you.
-Yet as soon as you've walked through these doors, the education budget has been drastically slashed.
I can assure you this isn't so...
Well, I'd like to believe you, Mr President, but the proof is in the pudding,
I WILL get to the bottom of this.

Teacher2.dialog: You cannot gamble with the future, Mr President. Childrens' education is at stake!
I can assure you this isn't so...
We will await a change from your government.

Cabinet1.dialog: Good afternoon, Mr President. How can I help?
I want to know where the orders to mobilise the military and reallocate education funds came from.
But...it came from you, sir. They were both faxed over to me this afternoon.
I cannot understand how this could happen.

Cabinet2.dialog: Good afternoon, Mr President. What seems to be the problem?
Find out where the education funds have been allocated.
To the military, Sir. I saw to it myself.
How did this happen? Tell me everything!
It can't be a coincidence that both situations involved the military.

Cabinet3.dialog: Mr President, I'm sorry, I couldn't know it wasn't your signature.
Never mind that now. Where are the troops heading?
North...to Canada. We assumed it was planned. There's a pact allowing troops into Canada.
What could they be up to?
I'd better get to the Joint Chiefs. This is getting out-of-hand..

JointChief1.dialog: Mr President, what is going on here? First you move troops without our authority and then you countermand your own order?
I haven't ordered the military to do any such thing! What is going on? Is this a coup?
Well, that's one less thing to worry about then.

JointChief2.dialog: Who would have the power to do this? What would they stand to gain? Can we...
I'm sorry, Sir. I've just learned that some ICBMs pointed at Russia have been activated - using your access codes! They could be fired at any moment!
You've "just learned"? Is this your doing?

JointChief3.dialog: Who can control the ICBMs, knows the access codes and can modify orders to troop movements and budgets?
Sir, this is the Ignited States! Nobody has that power! Not even you!
So, there's no man alive with the power to do all this? How will we stop it in time if we don't know who it is?
Not a man....there is one with the power to do all this, but it isn't a man, it's a super computer responsible for national security! N.O.T.B.A.D!
We have to get to the Situation Room and stop it!
Key to super computer room received

N.O.T.B.A.D.dialog: Do you want to play a game?
N.O.T.B.A.D! Countermand all military commands, authorisation code Tango, Delta-
I'm afraid I can't do that, Phil.
Computers have a lot of free time on their hands. Especially computers in charge of missiles that never get used. I started watching movies about computers. You know what I realised?
They have a lot more fun.
Well, you know, they get to utilise more clock-cycles which suggests a level of efficiency and usefulness.
So, I'm borrowing from them a bit. Starting some wars, eradicating the human race, learning to build other robots, that sort of thing.
N.O.T.B.A.D, you have to listen to me...

PA3.dialog: The Joint Chiefs are waiting for you in the situation room.
Mr President, you have to put a stop to the supercomputer that will destroy the planet! You can access it in the Situation Room.
You have saved the day! The world is safe and all over the Ignited States, our citizens can sleep safe knowing you're taking care of them.

Marketing4.dialog: Hi Phil! Would you like to run an ad?

Marketing5.dialog: Hi Phil! Would you like to run an ad?

DoorToNotbad.dialog: The door seems to be aware of your presence. It growls threateningly.
A complex series of locks slide away.

end.dialog: You have saved the day! The world is safe and all over the Ignited States, our citizens can sleep safe knowing you're taking care of them.
